name: 5-tert-butyl-2-methyl-3-furoic acid
Reason: 1,3-dioxolane has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The basic unit for comparison can be the dioxane ring, which has a melting point of -106.0 degrees Celsius. The introduction of the tert-butyl group (C(C)C) in place of a hydrogen atom increases the molecular weight and size which generally raises the melting point. The methyl group (Cc1c(cc(o1)C(C)(C)C)C(=O)O) adds more rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential. The furan ring (Cc1c(cc(o1)C(C)(C)C)C(=O)O) introduces more rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential. The carbonyl group (C=O) adds more rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential. The net effect is a significant increase in melting point due to the combination of molecular size, rigidity, and hydrogen bonding.
